result.execSummary:
The defendant Steven M Wilson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Fine to be paid in 60 days or penalty of 7 days jail for non-payment.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Steven M Wilson

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Steven M Wilson in court.  Ted S. Szczupakiewicz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant appears and states he wishes to proceed pro se. Court performs colloquy with Defendant regarding his right to counsel.  Defendant waives his right to counsel and states he wishes to proceed to plea and sentence today without counsel.  Defendant enters a no contest plea to Count #1.  Court performs plea colloquy and finds Defendant guilty of Count #1.  State gives sentencing recommendation.  Defendant makes statements.  Court sentences the Defendant to the following:

COUNT #1:  FINE:   $379.00 (to be paid in 60 days, alternate 7 days jail if not paid)

Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Defendant not to discuss the facts of this case with the codefendant.

Defendant Steven M Wilson in court.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court advises of right to an attorney.  Defendant does not wish to obtain counsel.    NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY COURT.
  Hearing scheduled for October 9, 2015 at 10:30 am.
Initial appearance on September 8, 2015 at 08:15 am.

Defendant Steven M Wilson not in court.  Mary C. Brejcha appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Mr. Willson's father appeared and advised court that the defendant is in Arizona for work and will be back in one month. State has no objection to adjournment. Court adjourns initial appearance.  Initial appearance scheduled for September 8, 2015 at 08:15 am.
